thinking: On turn 0, I will prioritize resource gathering and worker production. The worker at (1,1) will begin harvesting from the closest resource node at (0,0) and returning them to the base at (2,1). Simultaneously, the base at (2,1) will train a new worker to increase our resource income rapidly, as per the strategy to always produce workers from the base.

My strategy is to continually train workers from my base. I will designate one worker to continuously harvest resources to sustain production. All other workers will be sent to attack the enemy base at (5, 6) to overwhelm them as quickly as possible, as per the 'all in' strategy.

My strategy is to continuously produce workers from my base. One worker will focus solely on harvesting resources from the nearest node at (0,0) and delivering them to my base at (2,1) to ensure a steady supply for training. All other available workers will immediately be sent to attack the enemy base at (5,6) to overwhelm it as quickly as possible. The enemy base has low HP (6), so an 'all-in' worker attack could be decisive.

My strategy is to continuously train workers from the base. I will assign one worker to harvest resources to maintain resource flow. All other available workers will be sent to attack the enemy base at (5, 6) as an 'all-in' strategy to destroy it as quickly as possible.

The enemy base at (5, 6) has very low HP (3). My primary goal is to destroy it immediately to win the game. I will commit all available workers to attack the enemy base. My own base will continue to train workers to reinforce or replace units if needed, or to start harvesting if the attack fails to finish the game this turn. Given the low HP of the enemy base, an all-in attack is the most efficient strategy.

The primary goal is to establish a strong economy by continuously training workers and sending them to harvest resources. I will prioritize training workers from the base and sending the existing workers to the nearest resource nodes. The base at (2,1) will train a worker. The worker at (2,0) will harvest from the resource at (0,0) and return to base (2,1). The worker at (4,6) will harvest from the resource at (7,7) and return to base (2,1). There are no immediate enemy threats to my base, so economic development is the focus.
